com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.filter.account

Class DefaultJwtAccountResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.filter.account.DefaultJwtAccountResolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JwtAccountResolver

    public class DefaultJwtAccountResolver
extends Object
implements JwtAccountResolver
    Sine 1.0.0 we are restricting this resolver to only function for Access Tokens but not for Refresh Tokens. This change provides the fix for: https://github.com/stormpath/stormpath-sdk-java/issues/674
    Since:
    1.0.RC3

      • getAccountByJwt

        public Account getAccountByJwt(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                               String jwt)
        Description copied from interface: JwtAccountResolver
        Authenticates and validates the specified JWT token string and then returns the Account corresponding to the valid JWT. If the JWT is invalid, it will throw a runtime exception.
        Specified by:
        getAccountByJwt in interface JwtAccountResolver
        Parameters:
        request - inbound request
        response - outbound response
        jwt - the JWT token string to authenticate and inspect for an associated Account identity.
        Returns:
        the Account corresponding to the valid JWT

      • getClient

        protected Client getClient(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
